Description: Body sherd of North Ionian pottery bowl; interior glazed with two friezes of incised ornament (any added colour worn): above, perhaps rosettes and tongues; below, lotus flowers and buds; exterior slipped cream; three friezes preserved, divided by bands with added red bands lined in white; above, stopt maeander; centre, two goats running to left, one looking back; below trace of decoration.
Curator's comments: From the same bowl as 1886,0601.991, 993 and 1088.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.560)
